amendment.description: Amendment increases funding for Veterans Administration medical care by $40 million and the general operating expenses for the Veterans Benefits Administration by $17 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 59 as printed in the Congressional Record to increase the VA's medical care account by $40 million and to increase the VA's benefit administration operating expenses by $17 million from its current level of $824 million. The offset would come from a 0.4 percent reduction from the amount appropriated for Army Cemeterial expenses and a reduction in amounts appropriated for the American Battle Monuments Commision and Court of Veterans Appeals of $40 million and $17 million respectively.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Stump amendment (A024) Agreed to by voice vote.
